ctrlnmod.utils package

Submodules

ctrlnmod.utils.data module

class ctrlnmod.utils.data.Experiment(u, y, ts=1, x=None, nx=None, x_trainable=False, d=None)[source]

Bases: Dataset

This class represents a single experiment with inputs (u), outputs (y), and optionally states (x) and disturbances (d). It is designed to handle time-series data, where each experiment can have a different number of samples. .. attribute:: u

Input data of shape (n_samples, nu).

type:

Tensor

y

Output data of shape (n_samples, ny).

Type:

Tensor

ts

Sampling time.

Type:

float

x

State data of shape (n_samples, nx).

Type:

Tensor, optional

nu

Number of inputs.

Type:

int

ny

Number of outputs.

Type:

int

nx

Number of states.

Type:

int, optional

n_samples

Number of samples in the experiment.

Type:

int

x_trainable

Whether the state vector is trainable.

Type:

bool

d

Disturbance data of shape (n_samples, nd).

Type:

Tensor, optional

__getitem__(idx, seq_len)[source]

Returns a tuple of (u, y, x, x0) for the given index and sequence length.

__len__()[source]

Returns the number of samples in the experiment.

denormalize(u=None, y=None, x=None, scaler=None)[source]

Denormalizes the data if a scaler is provided.

Parameters:

  • u (Tensor | None)

  • y (Tensor | None)

  • x (Tensor | None)

  • d (Tensor | None)

get_data(idx=None, unscaled=False, scaler=None)[source]

Returns the experiment data up to the specified index.

plot(idx=None, unscaled=False, scaler=None)[source]

Plots the experiment data.

Parameters:

  • u (np.ndarray) – Input data of shape (n_samples, nu).

  • y (np.ndarray) – Output data of shape (n_samples, ny).

  • ts (float) – Sampling time.

  • x (np.ndarray, optional) – State data of shape (n_samples, nx). Defaults to None.

  • nx (int, optional) – Number of states. If x is provided, this must match x.shape[1]. Defaults to None.

  • x_trainable (bool) – Whether the state vector is trainable. Defaults to False.

  • d (np.ndarray, optional) – Disturbance data of shape (n_samples, nd). Defaults to None.

Raises:

  • ValueError – If u and y do not have the same number of samples, or if x is provided but x_trainable is True.

  • ValueError – If x is None and nx is not provided.

  • ValueError – If seq_len is invalid.

denormalize(u=None, y=None, x=None, d=None, scaler=None)[source]

Dénormalise les données si un scaler est fourni

Parameters:

  • u (Tensor | None)

  • y (Tensor | None)

  • x (Tensor | None)

  • d (Tensor | None)

get_data(idx=None, unscaled=False, scaler=None)[source]

Return the experiment values up to the idx index if idx is not None :type idx: :param idx: Optional[int] - Index jusqu’auquel récupérer les données :type unscaled: :param unscaled: bool - Si True et si un scaler est fourni, retourne les données dénormalisées :type scaler: :param scaler: Optional[BaseScaler] - Scaler pour la dénormalisation

Returns:

Tuple[Tensor, Tensor, Tensor] - (u, y, x) normalisés ou non

plot(idx=None, unscaled=False, scaler=None)[source]

Affiche les données de l’expérience jusqu’à l’index idx

class ctrlnmod.utils.data.ExperimentsDataModule(train_set, val_set, batch_size=32, num_workers=0, max_idx_val=None)[source]

Bases: LightningDataModule

Parameters:

  • val_set (ExperimentsDataset)

  • batch_size (int)

  • num_workers (int)

  • max_idx_val (int | None)

setup(stage=None)[source]

Called at the beginning of fit (train + validate), validate, test, or predict. This is a good hook when you need to build models dynamically or adjust something about them. This hook is called on every process when using DDP.

Parameters:

stage – either 'fit', 'validate', 'test', or 'predict'

Example:

class LitModel(...):
    def __init__(self):
        self.l1 = None

    def prepare_data(self):
        download_data()
        tokenize()

        # don't do this
        self.something = else

    def setup(self, stage):
        data = load_data(...)
        self.l1 = nn.Linear(28, data.num_classes)
train_dataloader(unscaled=False)[source]

An iterable or collection of iterables specifying training samples.

For more information about multiple dataloaders, see this section.

The dataloader you return will not be reloaded unless you set :paramref:`~lightning.pytorch.trainer.trainer.Trainer.reload_dataloaders_every_n_epochs` to a positive integer.

For data processing use the following pattern:

  • download in prepare_data()

  • process and split in setup()

However, the above are only necessary for distributed processing.

Warning

do not assign state in prepare_data

  • fit()

  • prepare_data()

  • setup()

Note

Lightning tries to add the correct sampler for distributed and arbitrary hardware. There is no need to set it yourself.

val_dataloader(unscaled=False)[source]

An iterable or collection of iterables specifying validation samples.

For more information about multiple dataloaders, see this section.

The dataloader you return will not be reloaded unless you set :paramref:`~lightning.pytorch.trainer.trainer.Trainer.reload_dataloaders_every_n_epochs` to a positive integer.

It’s recommended that all data downloads and preparation happen in prepare_data().

  • fit()

  • validate()

  • prepare_data()

  • setup()

Note

Lightning tries to add the correct sampler for distributed and arbitrary hardware There is no need to set it yourself.

Note

If you don’t need a validation dataset and a validation_step(), you don’t need to implement this method.

class ctrlnmod.utils.data.ExperimentsDataset(exps, seq_len=1, scaler=None)[source]

Bases: Dataset

This class implements methods to deal with sequences potentially coming from several experiments and from different length.

Bases: Dataset

This class represents a single experiment with inputs (u), outputs (y), and optionally states (x) and disturbances (d). It is designed to handle time-series data, where each experiment can have a different number of samples. .. attribute:: u

Input data of shape (n_samples, nu).

plot(idx=None, unscaled=False, scaler=None)[source]

Plots the experiment data.

Parameters:

  • u (np.ndarray) – Input data of shape (n_samples, nu).

  • y (np.ndarray) – Output data of shape (n_samples, ny).

  • ts (float) – Sampling time.

  • x (np.ndarray, optional) – State data of shape (n_samples, nx). Defaults to None.

  • nx (int, optional) – Number of states. If x is provided, this must match x.shape[1]. Defaults to None.

  • x_trainable (bool) – Whether the state vector is trainable. Defaults to False.

  • d (np.ndarray, optional) – Disturbance data of shape (n_samples, nd). Defaults to None.

Raises:

  • ValueError – If u and y do not have the same number of samples, or if x is provided but x_trainable is True.

  • ValueError – If x is None and nx is not provided.

  • ValueError – If seq_len is invalid.
